info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 1:50AM MST until January 02 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SNOW CONTINUES IN THE MOUNTAINS WITH SNOW AND FREEZING DRIZZLE CONTINUING OVER THE PLAINS AND URBAN CORRIDOR TODAY... .Widespread snow, mostly light to moderate in intensity, will continue for most of the region through the early morning hours. Snow will become more scattered in nature after daybreak Monday, when the I-25 corridor and plains are expected to see the development of freezing drizzle. By the afternoon, snow showers are expected to return to most areas and increase in coverage once again. Slick travel can be expected at times due to the snow and locally light ice accumulations, including for both the morning and evening commutes. Snow will taper off for the urban corridor and mountains in the late afternoon and evening respectively, however will linger through Monday night in the northeast plains. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and freezing drizzle. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 4 inches expected, along with possible ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Fort Collins, Loveland and Greeley. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination.
